hypothesis_content.title: Memecoin Liquidity Flash During Low Volatility Periods
hypothesis_content.statement: During periods of suppressed BTC volatility (20-day HV < 40%) and neutral regime, excess speculative liquidity floods into memecoins (DOGE, PEPE, TRUMP) for 24-72 hour bursts, creating exploitable momentum patterns.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Traders bored during low-volatility periods allocate risk capital to high-beta memecoins for quick returns. Social media amplification creates self-reinforcing liquidity flows that are time-limited but predictable.
entry_conditions: DOGE or PEPE volume spike > 200% of 7-day average
Positive funding rates on memecoin perpetuals (<0.01% to avoid overcrowding)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 25% gain OR volume drops below 150% of 7-day average
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 12% loss OR BTC volatility spikes (>5% daily move)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Low volatility leads to capital exiting crypto entirely rather than rotating to riskier assets; memecoin moves fail to attract follow-through volume.
